definition: to look for/to seek/to choose/color of object/color of fleece (of domestic animal)/to see/to notice/all kinds of things/odds and ends
thing/object/matter/abbr. for physics 物理
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex
color/dice

sentences.english: They are marching off to gyms and discovering face cream in record numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他們向健身房進軍，物色到的面霜數目已創歷史新高。

sentences.english: The new premier is forming his government mainly from young men.
sentences.chinese: 這位新總理主要從年輕人中物色人選組建政府。

sentences.english: I'll try my best to rout out a good goalkeeper for our football team.
sentences.chinese: 我願盡力爲我們的足球隊物色一位優秀的守門員。

sentences.english: We have lined up a speaker for the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我們已經爲這個會物色到一個發言人。

sentences.english: The company is casting its net wide in its search for a new sales director.
sentences.chinese: 公司撒開大網到處物色新的銷售主任。

sentences.english: So I began to look for a husband.
sentences.chinese: 因此我開始物色一個丈夫。

sentences.english: American military leaders began looking for someone to lead the attack.
sentences.chinese: 軍方領導人開始物色合適人選。

sentences.english: They are beating the bushes for qualified persons in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在四處物色這方面的人才。

sentences.english: We is offering a general agent for our textile in singapore.
sentences.chinese: 我公司欲在新加坡物色一名紡織品總代理。

sentences.english: I have lighted upon the book I wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我已物色到我所需要的那本書了。

sentences.english: They are hunting up the most promising candidates for the position.
sentences.chinese: 他們正在極力物色最適於這個職位的人選。

sentences.english: Eg. The company is casting its net wide in its search for a new sales director.
sentences.chinese: 公司撒開大網到處物色新的銷售主任。

sentences.english: I will try and root out some good players for the basketball team.
sentences.chinese: 我將設法給籃球隊物色幾個優秀的選手。

sentences.english: The personnel manager has been casting about for somebody who can act as receptionist.
sentences.chinese: 人事部經理一直在到處物色接待員的人選。

sentences.english: A: I'm looking for a sleeveless blouse for my girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我正在爲我女朋友物色一條無袖短衫。

sentences.english: The proposal came at a crucial time for Geithner, who has struggled to fill positions in his team.
sentences.chinese: 蓋特納一直在竭力爲他團隊中的空缺職位物色人選。

definition: choice of person/candidate
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to have a preference for/to fancy/to choose after consideration/to settle on
to recommend sb/to give a referral
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
to introduce (sb)/(esp.) to present to the emperor
to find to one's taste/to pick (after looking at)/Taiwan pr. [xiang4 zhong4]
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
to act as a matchmaker
ideal husband/"Mr. Right"
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
ideal son-in-law
